member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventActivityOptions
member.summary: Specifies the tracking of activity start and stop events.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventActivityOptions.Detachable
member.summary: Allow overlapping activities. By default, activity starts and stops must be property nested. That is, a sequence of Start A, Start B, Stop A, Stop B is not allowed will result in B stopping at the same time as A.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventActivityOptions.Disable
member.summary: Turn off start and stop tracking.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventActivityOptions.None
member.summary: Use the default behavior for start and stop tracking.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventActivityOptions.Recursive
member.summary: Allow recursive activity starts. By default, an activity cannot be recursive. That is, a sequence of Start A, Start A, Stop A, Stop A is not allowed. Unintentional recursive activities can occur if the app executes and for some the stop is not reached before another start is called.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute
member.summary: Specifies additional event schema information for an event.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified event identifier.
member.param: The event identifier for the event.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.ActivityOptions
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the start and stop events of an activity. An activity is the region of time in an app between the start and the stop.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.Channel
member.summary: Gets or sets an additional event log where the event should be written.
member.returns: An additional event log where the event should be written.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.EventId
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier for the event.
member.returns: The event identifier. This value should be between 0 and 65535.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.Keywords
member.summary: Gets or sets the keywords for the event.
member.returns: A bitwise combination of the enumeration values.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.Level
member.summary: Gets or sets the level for the event.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that specifies the level for the event.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets the message for the event.
member.returns: The message for the event.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.Opcode
member.summary: Gets or sets the operation code for the event.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that specifies the operation code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.Tags
member.summary: Gets and sets the value for this object. An event tag is a user-defined value that is passed through when the event is logged.
member.returns: Returns the value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.Task
member.summary: Gets or sets the task for the event.
member.returns: The task for the event.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventAttribute.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the event.
member.returns: The version of the event.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventChannel
member.summary: Specifies the event log channel for the event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventChannel.Admin
member.summary: The administrator log channel.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventChannel.Analytic
member.summary: The analytic channel.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventChannel.Debug
member.summary: The debug channel.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventChannel.None
member.summary: No channel specified.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventChannel.Operational
member.summary: The operational channel.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventCommand
member.summary: Describes the command ( property) that is passed to the callback.

member.summary: Disable the event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventCommand.Enable
member.summary: Enable the event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventCommand.SendManifest
member.summary: Send the manifest.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventCommand.Update
member.summary: Update the event.

member.summary: Provides the arguments for the callback.

member.summary: Gets the array of arguments for the callback.
member.returns: An array of callback arguments.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventCommandEventArgs.Command
member.summary: Gets the command for the callback.
member.returns: The callback command.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventCommandEventArgs.DisableEvent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Disables the event that have the specified identifier.
member.returns: true if is in range; otherwise, false.
member.param: The identifier of the event to disable.

member.summary: Enables the event that has the specified identifier.
member.returns: true if is in range; otherwise, false.
member.param: The identifier of the event to enable.

member.summary: Specifies a type to be passed to the method.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or set the name to apply to an event if the event type or property is not explicitly named.
member.returns: The name to apply to the event or property.

member.summary: The is placed on fields of user-defined types that are passed as payloads.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets and sets the value that specifies how to format the value of a user-defined type.
member.returns: Returns a value.

member.summary: Gets and sets the user-defined value that is required for fields that contain data that isn't one of the supported types.

member.summary: Specifies how to format the value of a user-defined type and can be used to override the default formatting for a field.

member.summary: Boolean

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventFieldFormat.Default
member.summary: Default.

member.summary: Hexadecimal.

member.summary: HResult.

member.summary: JSON.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventFieldFormat.String
member.summary: String.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventFieldFormat.Xml
member.summary: XML.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventFieldTags
member.summary: Specifies the user-defined tag that is placed on fields of user-defined types that are passed as payloads through the .

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventFieldTags.None
member.summary: Specifies no tag and is equal to zero.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventIgnoreAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a property should be ignored when writing an event type with the method.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventIgnoreAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords
member.summary: Defines the standard keywords that apply to events.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords.All
member.summary: All the bits are set to 1, representing every possible group of events.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords.AuditFailure
member.summary: Attached to all failed security audit events. Use this keyword only for events in the security log.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords.AuditSuccess
member.summary: Attached to all successful security audit events. Use this keyword only for events in the security log.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords.CorrelationHint
member.summary: Attached to transfer events where the related activity ID (correlation ID) is a computed value and is not guaranteed to be unique (that is, it is not a real GUID).

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords.EventLogClassic
member.summary: Attached to events that are raised by using the RaiseEvent function.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords.None
member.summary: No filtering on keywords is performed when the event is published.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords.Sqm
member.summary: Attached to all Service Quality Mechanism (SQM) events.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords.WdiContext
member.summary: Attached to all Windows Diagnostics Infrastructure (WDI) context events.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords.WdiDiagnostic
member.summary: Attached to all Windows Diagnostics Infrastructure (WDI) diagnostic events.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel
member.summary: Identifies the level of an event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel.Critical
member.summary: This level corresponds to a critical error, which is a serious error that has caused a major failure.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel.Error
member.summary: This level adds standard errors that signify a problem.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel.Informational
member.summary: This level adds informational events or messages that are not errors. These events can help trace the progress or state of an application.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel.LogAlways
member.summary: No level filtering is done on the event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel.Verbose
member.summary: This level adds lengthy events or messages. It causes all events to be logged.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel.Warning
member.summary: This level adds warning events (for example, events that are published because a disk is nearing full capacity).

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventListener
member.summary: Provides methods for enabling and disabling events from event sources.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventListener.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventListener.DisableEvents(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource)
member.summary: Disables all events for the specified event source.
member.param: The event source to disable events for.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventListener.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the resources used by the current instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventListener.EnableEvents(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource,System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel)
member.summary: Enables events for the specified event source that has the specified verbosity level or lower.
member.param: The event source to enable events for.
The level of events to enable.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventListener.EnableEvents(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource,System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel,System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords)
member.summary: Enables events for the specified event source that has the specified verbosity level or lower, and matching keyword flags.
member.param: The event source to enable events for.
The level of events to enable.
The keyword flags necessary to enable the events.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventListener.EnableEvents(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource,System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel,System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Enables events for the specified event source that has the specified verbosity level or lower, matching event keyword flag, and matching arguments.
member.param: The event source to enable events for.
The level of events to enable.
The keyword flags necessary to enable the events.
The arguments to be matched to enable the events.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventListener.EventSourceIndex(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource)
member.summary: Gets a small non-negative number that represents the specified event source.
member.returns: A small non-negative number that represents the specified event source.
member.param: The event source to find the index for.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventListener.OnEventSourceCreated(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource)
member.summary: Called for all existing event sources when the event listener is created and when a new event source is attached to the listener.
member.param: The event source.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventListener.OnEventWritten(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventWrittenEventArgs)
member.summary: Called whenever an event has been written by an event source for which the event listener has enabled events.
member.param: The event arguments that describe the event.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventManifestOptions
member.summary: Specifies how the ETW manifest for the event source is generated.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventManifestOptions.AllCultures
member.summary: Generates a resources node under the localization folder for every satellite assembly provided.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventManifestOptions.AllowEventSourceOverride
member.summary: Overrides the default behavior that the current must be the base class of the user-defined type passed to the write method. This enables the validation of .NET event sources.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventManifestOptions.None
member.summary: No options are specified.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventManifestOptions.OnlyIfNeededForRegistration
member.summary: A manifest is generated only the event source must be registered on the host computer.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventManifestOptions.Strict
member.summary: Causes an exception to be raised if any inconsistencies occur when writing the manifest file.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode
member.summary: Defines the standard operation codes that the event source attaches to events.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.DataCollectionStart
member.summary: A trace collection start event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.DataCollectionStop
member.summary: A trace collection stop event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.Extension
member.summary: An extension event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.Info
member.summary: An informational event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.Receive
member.summary: An event that is published when one activity in an application receives data.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.Reply
member.summary: An event that is published after an activity in an application replies to an event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.Resume
member.summary: An event that is published after an activity in an application resumes from a suspended state. The event should follow an event that has the operation code.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.Send
member.summary: An event that is published when one activity in an application transfers data or system resources to another activity.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.Start
member.summary: An event that is published when an application starts a new transaction or activity. This operation code can be embedded within another transaction or activity when multiple events that have the code follow each other without an intervening event that has a code.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.Stop
member.summary: An event that is published when an activity or a transaction in an application ends. The event corresponds to the last unpaired event that has a operation code.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode.Suspend
member.summary: An event that is published when an activity in an application is suspended.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource
member.summary: Provides the ability to create events for event tracing for Windows (ETW).

The key-value pairs that specify traits for the event source.
member.exception: is not specified in key-value pairs.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.ConstructionException
member.summary: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Gets any exception that was thrown during the construction of the event source.
member.returns: The exception that was thrown during the construction of the event source, or null if no exception was thrown.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.CurrentThreadActivityId
member.summary: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Gets the activity ID of the current thread.
member.returns: The activity ID of the current thread.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.Finalize
member.summary: Allows the object to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before the object is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.summary: Returns a string of the XML manifest that is associated with the current event source.
member.returns: The XML data string.
member.param: The type of the event source.
The path to the assembly file (.dll) to include in the provider element of the manifest.

member.returns: The XML data string or null (see remarks).
member.param: The type of the event source.
The path to the assembly file (.dll) file to include in the provider element of the manifest.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specify how the manifest is generated.

member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this implementation of the event source.

member.summary: Gets the friendly name of the event source.
member.returns: The friendly name of the event source. The default is the simple name of the class.
member.param: The type of the event source.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.GetSources
member.summary: Gets a snapshot of all the event sources for the application domain.
member.returns: An enumeration of all the event sources in the application domain.

member.summary: Gets the trait value associated with the specified key.
member.returns: The trait value associated with the specified key. If the key is not found, returns null.
member.param: The key of the trait to get.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.Guid
member.summary: The unique identifier for the event source.
member.returns: A unique identifier for the event source.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.IsEnabled
member.summary: Determines whether the current event source is enabled.
member.returns: true if the current event source is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.IsEnabled(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel,System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords)
member.summary: Determines whether the current event source that has the specified level and keyword is enabled.
member.returns: true if the event source is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.param: The level of the event source.
The keyword of the event source.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.IsEnabled(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventLevel,System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventKeywords,System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventChannel)
member.summary: Determines whether the current event source is enabled for events with the specified level, keywords and channel.
member.returns: true if the event source is enabled for the specified event level, keywords and channel; otherwise, false.The result of this method is only an approximation of whether a particular event is active. Use it to avoid expensive computation for logging when logging is disabled. Event sources may have additional filtering that determines their activity..
member.param: The event level to check. An event source will be considered enabled when its level is greater than or equal to .
The event keywords to check.
The event channel to check.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.Name
member.summary: The friendly name of the class that is derived from the event source.
member.returns: The friendly name of the derived class. The default is the simple name of the class.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.OnEventCommand(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventCommandEventArgs)
member.summary: Called when the current event source is updated by the controller.
member.param: The arguments for the event.

member.summary: Sends a command to a specified event source.

The event command to send.
The arguments for the event command.

member.summary: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Sets the activity ID on the current thread.

member.param: The current thread's new activity ID, or to indicate that work on the current thread is not associated with any activity.
When this method returns, contains the previous activity ID on the current thread.

member.summary: Gets the settings applied to this event source.

The options such as level, keywords and operation code for the event.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or null if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceOptions
member.summary: Specifies overrides of default event settings such as the log level, keywords and operation code when the method is called.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceOptions.ActivityOptions
member.summary: The activity options defined for this event source.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceOptions.Keywords
member.summary: Gets or sets the keywords applied to the event. If this property is not set, the event’s keywords will be None.
member.returns: The keywords applied to the event, or None if no keywords are set.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceOptions.Level
member.summary: Gets or sets the event level applied to the event.
member.returns: The event level for the event. If not set, the default is Verbose (5).

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceOptions.Opcode
member.summary: Gets or sets the operation code to use for the specified event.
member.returns: The operation code to use for the specified event. If not set, the default is Info (0).

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceOptions.Tags
member.summary: The event tags defined for this event source.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceSettings
member.summary: Specifies configuration options for an event source.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceSettings.Default
member.summary: None of the special configuration options are enabled.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceSettings.EtwManifestEventFormat
member.summary: The ETW listener should use a manifest-based format when raising events. Setting this option is a directive to the ETW listener should use manifest-based format when raising events. This is the default option when defining a type derived from using one of the protected constructors.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceSettings.EtwSelfDescribingEventFormat
member.summary: The ETW listener should use self-describing event format. This is the default option when creating a new instance of the using one of the public constructors.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceSettings.ThrowOnEventWriteErrors
member.summary: The event source throws an exception when an error occurs.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventTags
member.summary: Specifies the tracking of activity start and stop events. You should only use the lower 24 bits. For more information, see and .

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventTags.None
member.summary: Specifies no tag and is equal to zero.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventTask.None
